Relatedness (SDT)

Backlinks

  • Value caring
    • It means satisfying the need for relatedness (Relatedness (SDT)); being sensitive to others and having them be sensitive to yours. It means to support each other's autonomy, to help each other build competence and skills that you'd like to build, and to support and try to understand each other's interests.
  • §Stronger Together (platonic)
    • Some of it is the psychological safety that, if things go wrong, we’re not alone and we’ll solve the problem. This is one of the core ways of satisfying Relatedness (SDT).
  • People can only support your intentions if they know what they are
    • This is a major way of supporting Relatedness (SDT), and one of the reasons that Vulnerability is required for caring.
  • MIL avoids burnout
    • Caring with others (Relatedness (SDT))
  • §Recreation
    • Caring with others (Relatedness (SDT))
  • Why does Mieke enjoy spending time at her parents
    • This is part of what is needed for Relatedness (SDT), but it is not enough – they also need to understand her and support her autonomy, something she feels they do less. Part of that is due to how interested they are in learning new things, part of it is due to how authentic Mieke believes her mother’s statements are.
